Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Echo two-six to command. Colonel, we have eyes on three Kong in the north woods. A couple of our donkeys think there are others here too... Maybe this is it, maybe the base is near.  Yes sir... Yes sir, copy. Over.

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: I can't see anything! We lost a lot of men, sir -- the captain is dead!

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: Command, sir? I think it's just me by myself now!

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: Sir, I don't think I'm gonna make it...! I'm sorry -- I'm so sorry!

Speaker: lang
Dialogue: Means we're the beginning and end. Humanity's survival depends on us.

Speaker: travis
Dialogue: What? They're animals, he's gonna slaughter us --

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I... did not start this war.

Speaker: travis
Dialogue: And we got ten more just like him.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I know these apes. They followed Koba...  They tried to kill me. They fear what I will do to them. They believe I cannot forgive. So now they serve you... just to survive.

Speaker: red
Dialogue: I no fear you! You must fear! How long you think woods can protect you? Humans destroy you. Their Kerna has all power. Humans follow all he say. To them, he more than just human. He everything.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Tell your Colonel... you have seen me now. And I have a message for him: this fighting can stop. Leave us the woods. And no more humans will die.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Do you really think they'll give him the message?]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: They are the message. I showed them mercy. He will see we are not savages.  Let's hope this works. They are getting closer...

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: That Koba could not forgive what humans did to him when he was their prisoner. That he would seek revenge. I should have known.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [No one could have known how much darkness was living inside of him.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Welcome home, Rocket.  You look tired.

Speaker: blue eyes
Dialogue: [This is it, Father. We can start over. A new home.]

Speaker: blue eyes
Dialogue: [A desert, Rocket and I had to cross it too. The journey is long, but that is why humans will not find us.]

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: [How much longer can we wait?      Soldiers are getting closer!]

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: [Your son's been gone, he doesn't know how hard it's been!]

Speaker: blue eyes
Dialogue: [I know you are scared, we all are, but we are still planning...]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Yes... We must still find a way to get out of the woods safely.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I know, son.  More apes die everyday. And we cannot hide here much longer.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: [I am so proud of you.]  [I love you, son.]

Speaker: female soldier
Dialogue: Lima-two to command. Colonel, intel's good. I'm in the target area. Are you close?

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Lima-four to command.   Colonel, did you get him--?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [I heard him talking!   The Colonel is here!]

Speaker: spear
Dialogue: [Luca! We can't find Winter.   He wasn't at his post.]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [He was scared. Could he have turned against us?]

Speaker: luca
Dialogue: [Caesar... I think Winter betrayed us. I'm sorry. He was in my command.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: My youngest son...   Have you found him yet?

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: You loved my son.    Look after his brother until I return.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Caesar, you are our leader!   We can't leave without you!]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: You must.    The soldiers will be back soon.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: When I find him, the soldiers will all come after me. That may give you the best chance to get out of the woods. Until then, be safe.

Speaker: luca
Dialogue: [The soldiers' camp is always moving. My guards think they know where it is. Let me take you.]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [You'll need me to back you up.]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [Please... I know what it's like... to lose a son.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I might not make it back.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [That's why I'm coming.   To make sure you do.]

Speaker: luca
Dialogue: [This is where the guards thought they might be. There are always fires burning.]

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I'm just gonna... put this down --

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Look around. Take what we can use.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Something wrong with her.   I don't think she can speak.]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Must be where they bury the dead.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Looks like some were killed here.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Why would they kill their own men?]

Speaker: boyle
Dialogue: Shut up, Preacher -- what're you, a donkey lover now? I think you going soft coz that kong let you go.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: [This morning. He took many soldiers with him.]

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: [I don't know. But more of us are leaving to join them in the morning. Red thinks they'll all be coming back here... to help the Colonel finish off the apes for good.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: My son... my wife... are dead.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [Wait for the soldiers to leave.   Follow them to the Colonel.]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Winter said they were heading to a border...!

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [I don't recognize him.   He's not one of us.]

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: I see girl. Think... you human.   But you... apes. Like me!

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Are there more like you?   More apes? From zoo?

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Amazing... Always thought we were the only ones. Wonder if there are others out there somewhere? Others like us.]

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: Here! Eat, eat!  New friends. Special day.

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: Bad place. Very bad. I find. Long time ago. After zoo. Looking for food. Find human zoo. Zoo for sick.

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [An old, deserted military camp on the border...?]

Speaker: luca
Dialogue: [Maybe this is where the Colonel and the troops from the north are going to meet?]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Is it far?     Can you take us?

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: Human zoo?! No... No go back there. Everyone dead. I come here. Safe here. Never go back!

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: No!     Can not take!   Can not take!

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: I see you look at her. Just now.  Look sad.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I had two.     But one was killed.   By human.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: [Luca, let's take a closer look.]  [Stay here. Keep them safe.]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [I saw them from up there... Coming for you...]

Speaker: luca
Dialogue: [At least this time... I was able to protect you...]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [I know how much you have lost... But now we have lost another.]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [Luca gave his life!   We can not turn back -- !]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: ...Koba? You know nothing.   My wife and son were killed.  You call me Koba...?!

Speaker: spear
Dialogue: [They came out of nowhere, attacked us... We were sure they would kill us all -- but the Colonel stopped them!]

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: I see... I kill somebody close to you that night...?

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: I'm sorry.     I was there to kill you.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I was told you were coming... That others would be joining you here.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: To finish us off... for good.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: You could use a haircut there, son.  You too, soldier.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I will find some way to get us out of here. I promise...

Speaker: lake
Dialogue: [You don't know what this place is like.]

Speaker: lake
Dialogue: [We haven't had food or water since we got here...]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: What did the Colonel promise you? You really think he will let you live... after we are gone?

Speaker: red
Dialogue: Koba right. You think you know better... than rest of apes. But look you now.  You nothing.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Interfere with the work again, and I'll begin slaughtering the apes, one by one. Understand? I need that wall.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: They'll get food and water when they finish the work.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Give them food and water... or they will not be able to finish.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: You know you're very emotional.  What makes you think you're in a position to make demands?

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: The soldiers who are coming here... are not coming to join you, are they?

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: I was told you were smart, but... that's impressive.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I think... you have no mercy.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: You came here to kill me.   Were you going to show me mercy?

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I showed you mercy... when I spared your men. I offered you peace. And you killed my family.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Mercy. Do you have any idea what your mercy would do to us?

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Except for the one I spared, so he could return to deliver a message: if they wanted to relieve me of my command, they'd have to meet me here, and do it themselves.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Probably all of them. Don't get any ideas -- only thing they fear more than me is you apes. They never questioned my methods when it came to you.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: What do you think my men would've done to your apes... if you had killed me?

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: Didn't I tell you not to agitate him? That was not smart, man...

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: If this battle is coming... you should leave, while you still can.

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: Leave?     What are you talking about?

Speaker: preacher
Dialogue: He was right, you do think he's sick, don't you? You're just like them. He's not crazy. The world's gone crazy. And he's the only one with the vision to get us through this. The Colonel's a great man. He sacrificed everything for us. You can't judge him. Who are you to judge him?  I was trying to give you a heads up, keep you out of his way, I don't even know why. But if you think you and I have some kind of relationship -- that you're gonna give me, what, advice? You can disavow yourself of that notion right fucking now.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: [Do not lose hope... Some way, somehow, we will finish the journey to our new home. I will find a way to get us out of here.]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [How will we get in?   Humans everywhere.]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Sick humans must have tried to escape underground!]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [Must be under the camp by now!]

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [Wonder how close we are... to where soldiers keep apes?]

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: If he's still alive in the morning, he goes back to work or you shoot him.  Keep him separate from the others.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: [If humans see her, they will kill her...]

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: How many are out there?   Are there others?

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: For two years we've fought relentlessly against these beasts, and when we are done with them, we will bring an end to their kind. But now we find ourselves on the eve of battle... against our own kind. So you may ask: who is the real enemy, who are we fighting here? And I'll tell you. It's not the apes. It's not the men who are on their way here right now to altercate with us. The battle we've been waging all this time is against ourselves.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Send him up to the quarry.    Alone.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: [37 steps to the adult cage...   55 to the children.]

Speaker: red
Dialogue: You know Kerna shoot apes tomorrow... when wall is done.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: His wall is madness. It won't save him... any more than it will save you.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Is there anything left... of you to save?

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [This is the ape I told you about.]

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [We can't dig any further, it will flood the whole tunnel!]

Speaker: lake
Dialogue: [If we don't dig further, we'll never get to the children! How are we going to get them out?]

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: Least you can take comfort... Your struggle ends... Ours goes on... Nature still has the power to wipe us off this planet at any moment... Killed the dinosaurs with a single meteor.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: I think that was his name, yes.

Speaker: the colonel
Dialogue: He said you were remarkable.   More than just an animal...

Speaker: rocket
Dialogue: [Do you think he knows we're up to something?]

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: [Wait till he turns out his lights.]

Speaker: bad ape
Dialogue: It's ok, little ones... come, come.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: By the time the sun rises, you'll all be on your way... to a new home.  Hurry, you must go.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Maurice was right. I am like Koba. He could not escape his hate...  And I still cannot escape mine. He took too much from me.

Speaker: gunner
Dialogue: Kill them, man!!!   Kill them all!!!

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Don't worry... You are all home now. Apes are strong. With... or without me.

Speaker: maurice
Dialogue: Son will know... who was father... and what Caesar... did... for us.
